section.name: Welcome Users
section.p: The OpenICF community shares an interest in improving and extending OpenICF software, and in adapting OpenICF to best fit our needs.
You are welcome to join us. Here are some ways to get started.

ul.li: Download and install a build from the download page.
Join the OpenICF mailing list to ask questions, make suggestions, and tell us what you think of OpenICF.
Read and edit OpenIDM Wiki documentation.

section.p: Looking forward to hearing from you.

section.name: Welcome Developers
section.p: If you are a Java developer interested in OpenICF, there are plenty of ways you can get actively involved in the community in addition to joining as an OpenICF user.

ul.li: Get the source. See instructions in the Guide to OpenICF Subversion.
Make sure you register to join the community, thus also registering to report issues, and describe requests for enhancements, as well as to edit OpenIDM Wiki documentation.
Participate and discuss your work on the OpenICF developer mailing list in addition to the OpenICF mailing list.

section.name: Welcome Partners
section.p: Want to partner with other OpenICF community members to bring solutions based on OpenICF to your customers?

ul.li: Come show off your expertise on the mailing list and in the chat room at irc.freenode.net #openidm.
Post your success stories and white papers on the OpenIDM Wiki.
